result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth M Grady

records.addlTxt:
2:37 PM Defendant Kenneth M Grady in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
The defendant has an attorney lined up but he has not been answering his phone. The court orders that the defendant drop off the name and phone number of the attorney or a business card by close of business on 11-1-2022. 
Initial appearance reset to 11-21-2022 at 1:30 p.m.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenneth M Grady in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant still is considering retaining counsel.  
IA reset to 10-31-2022 at 1:30pm
Adjourned initial appearance on October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:22 pm - Defendant Kenneth M Grady in court.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's employment situation has changed and he must reapply at public defender.  Initial appearance is set for 10-10-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.

2:11 pm - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kenneth M Grady in court.  Attorney Luke Harrison appearing with the defendant.  Public defender requests more time to appoint counsel in this matter.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 09-12-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.

Initial appearance on September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
(given to defendant in court)

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of physical abuse of child and disorderly conduct.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-08-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $750.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant is to have no contact with B.M.G., DOB: 09-11-2004.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 07-22-2022
